text: 242x242px Erich Brenter (born February 23, 1941) is an Austrian who was noted for his skill at skibobbing. In 1964 he set the world record for downhill skibobbing speed, with a recorded top speed of .Time (magazine): 1967 He reportedly held that record for 30 years. He is married to a Norwegian named Ranheid and is CEO of Brenter Snowbike.Brenter Snowbike promotional site ==References== Category:Austrian sportsmen Category:1941 births Category:Living people
title: Erich Brenter
